# Change Control (Git-based eQMS)

## 1) Change Type (select one)
- [ ] Editorial (wording/format only, no impact)
- [ ] Controlled (non-substantial) change
- [ ] Substantial change (potential regulatory/safety/performance impact)

## 4) Impact Analysis (proportionate)
### QMS impact
- Processes / procedures impacted:
- Training impact (if any):

### Product-related impact (lifecycle)
- Potential impact on product lifecycle activities:

### Risk impact
- RMF / risk controls impacted? (Yes/No) If yes, describe briefly:

### Regulatory impact
- MDR / standards / NB notification needed? (Yes/No/To be assessed)
- If substantial: specify rationale and next steps:

### Documentation impact
- Documents updated / created:
- Records created / updated (if applicable):

---

## 6) QMS Sync (required for controlled documents)
- [ ] I ran `make qms` before final commit
- [ ] YAML metadata is normalized
- [ ] `qms/00_index/SMQ-INDEX.md` is up to date (if impacted)

---

## 7) Approvals (how this becomes effective)
This change becomes effective when this Pull Request is approved and merged into `main`.
Approvals and merge history constitute the official approval and change record.
